div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Northern District of Washington.
In the matter of the application of D.A. Hatfield, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. | Order to show cause. No. 2082.

And now on the Fifth day of Feburary, A.D., 1912, the said cause came on to be heard upon an application for a writ of Habeas Corpus in said proceeding upon the Petition of D.A. Eatfield before the Hon. C.H. Hanford, one of the Judges of said Court, and upon reading the same and due consideration thereof, it is ordered that an order to show cause issue herein, directed to Robert T. Hodge, as sheriff of King county, and ex officio jailer of King county, state of Washington,

This Therefore, is to command you, the said Robert T. Hodge, sheriff, and as sheriff and ex-officio jailer of King County, state of Washington, to show cause why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue herein, before me, the undersigned, one of the judges of said court, on Tuesday the sixth day of Feburary, 1912, at the hour of ten A.M., at the court room of the United States District Court, in the Federal Building, in the City of Seattle, Washington, and you are further ordered to retain in your custody, the body of the said D.A. Hatfield, until the further order of this court.
A copy of this order and a copy of the petition of said D. A. Hatfield will be duly served herein.
Done in open court this 5th day of Feburary, 1912.
